page.title: 18H'borough Evangelical Church
page.content: The church was formed in 1973 when a group of Christians,mostly new to the town,felt the need for an evangelical fellowship on the Southern Estate. Having no church building they rented Farndon Fields School hall for their worship.Over their twelve years the church has expanded.It now has an active Youth Club and Sunday School and runs social events involving the wider community.It sees its purpose as spreading the faith in the Southern Estate,which it feels has many "unbelievers!"To further its work the church now realises that it needs a building of its own and has purchased 0.75 acres of land in Bath St. for this purpose.The design goes away from the conventional church building and includes a hall,kitchen,lounge,games room,2 classrooms and a chapel room.
